isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Service (1995 through 1999) - SECTION 11: ENGINE ELECTRICAL - ENGINE SENSORS AND CONNECTORS - SENSORS AND CONNECTORS

svcsubproc.title: Camshaft Position Sensor (CMP)
svcsubproc.para:
A Hall effect sensor stacked in front of a magnet with a signal conditioning integrated circuit. It responds to a rotating actuator positioned on the camshaft gear. The camshaft actuator has twenty-four (24) stamped windows. This produces a rectangular wave pulse for each tooth as the actuator rotates past the sensor. The pulses are used to indicate engine speed and camshaft position for control of fuel quantity, injection timing and overspeed shutdown. It is located on the engine front cover, RH side above the water pump pulley ( Figure 11.52
).

svcsubproc.title: Engine Coolant Temperature Sensor (ECT)
svcsubproc.para:
A thermistor type sensor which senses changes in engine coolant temperature. Located on the front RH side of the cylinder head, below the thermostat ( Figure 11.53
).

svcsubproc.title: Engine Oil Temperature Sensor (EOT)
svcsubproc.para:
A thermistor type sensor which senses engine oil temperature. Located on back LH side of the front cover above the high pressure pump housing. This sensor is used to provide engine temperature signal to the ECM which uses the information for fuel rate and timing adjustments ( Figure 11.53
).

svcsubproc.title: Injection Control Pressure Sensor (ICP)
svcsubproc.para:
A ceramic diaphragm sensor used to measure injection control/rail pressure. Located on the LH side of the engine. The sensor is either mounted in the three-way fitting, for engines equipped with the chassis mounted ECM or in the middle of the supply manifold, for engines equipped with the engine mounted ECM. This sensor provides injection control pressure feedback to the ECM for closed loop control of injector oil pressure ( Figure 11.55
).

svcsubproc.title: Injection Pressure Regulator Valve (IPR)
svcsubproc.para:
The valve achieves injection control pressure regulation. Located on LH side of high pressure pump. The IPR is a pulse width modulated valve which controls injector oil pressure via a signal from the ECM ( Figure 11.56
). Refer to engine diagnostic manual for further information.

svcsubproc.title: Manifold Absolute Pressure Sensor (MAP)
svcsubproc.para:
A ceramic diaphragm sensor which indicates manifold boost pressure or vacuum via a signal from the ECM. Located on on top of the valve cover/intake manifold ( Figure 11.57
).
